Baton_Rouge.F. G. Clark Center:
F.G. Clark Activity Center is a 7,500-seat multi-purpose arena in Baton Rouge, Louisiana that opened in 1975. It is home to the Southern Jaguars basketball and Southern Lady Jaguars basketball teams. The arena also holds concerts and other events.
The arena is named for Dr. Felton Grandison Clark, who was the second president of Southern University from 1938 to 1969.
